definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: He that rises late, must trot all day.
sentences.chinese: 晚起牀的人必須整天都要急步疾走。

sentences.english: No orders were heard but the traveling sound of the troop.
sentences.chinese: 又如赴敵之兵銜枚疾走，不聞號令，但聞人馬之行聲。

sentences.english: Like worker ants they rush around and scurry as if the world is at an end.
sentences.chinese: 象工作者螞蟻他們沖和疾走好象世界是在末端。

sentences.english: When it comes to locomotion, elephants are not exactly fleet of foot.
sentences.chinese: 但提到驅動力，確切說來大象沒辦法疾走。

sentences.english: The donkey began to trot faster , then to gallop.
sentences.chinese: 驢開始快速疾走，然後奔跑。

sentences.english: Make the police nine brother has a habit, just in the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 交警九哥有個習慣，只在馬路中央疾走。

sentences.english: Page 84: He was engulfed by the full force of the blast, but still stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 他被完全捲入一場爆炸，卻仍疾走如風。

sentences.english: I bent over the window, silently watching the fleet-footed people in the city.
sentences.chinese: 趴在窗戶上，默默觀察着城市中疾走的人羣。

definition: at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
